title: Make Camera the full-screen default start experience

requirements.text: Change the app launch flow so that the Camera is the default starting view for all users (authenticated, guest, and logged-out), and it renders as a full-screen “big camera” experience (no header/sidebar/container padding) immediately after the intro splash completes.

quotes: on sarting give all and big camera with it

acceptanceCriteria: After the intro splash finishes, the app shows the camera preview full-screen by default (no app shell chrome).
This is true even when the user is not authenticated and has not enabled guest mode.
The camera screen does not render inside the padded container layout used by non-camera windows.

requirements.text: Remove the current automatic redirect that forces logged-out users to the Login screen on startup; instead, keep the user on the full-screen Camera and provide a clear, non-blocking authentication prompt on the camera experience (e.g., an overlay or button group) to either sign in with Internet Identity or continue as guest.

quotes: on sarting give all and big camera with it

acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh load while logged out, the app stays on the Camera view (it does not automatically switch to the Login view).
The camera experience provides obvious actions to: (1) Sign in with Internet Identity, and (2) Continue as Guest.
The authentication prompt does not prevent viewing the camera preview.

requirements.text: Ensure camera actions behave safely when the user is not authenticated: allow viewing the camera preview, but when the user attempts actions that require identity-backed persistence (e.g., saving captured media), show an English message explaining they must sign in to save to Gallery (or offer to continue as guest where applicable).

quotes: on sarting give all and big camera with it

acceptanceCriteria: Logged-out users can see the live camera preview.
If a logged-out user attempts a save/persist action, the UI shows an English error/info message indicating sign-in is required to save.
No runtime errors occur from identity-required code paths when the user is logged out.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the backend architecture as a single Motoko actor; no new backend services.
nonGoals: Do not add new app features beyond changing the initial launch/default view and related auth gating.
Do not redesign unrelated screens (Gallery/Stories/Entertainment/etc.) as part of this request.
Do not change backend schemas or add migrations unless strictly required (not expected for this change).
